mecard.responder

Class BImportResponder

  • java.lang.Object
    • mecard.responder.Responder
      • mecard.responder.BImportResponder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Createable, Updateable

    public class BImportResponder
extends Responder
implements Updateable, Createable
    BImport responder has special capabilities to write files to the local file system and then execute local commands against that file.
    Since:
    1.1

      • createCustomer

        public void createCustomer(Response response)
        Looks confusing but merely converts the customer into a ILS meaningful expression of some sort (for BImport that's a command line expression or bat file name), then executes the command.
        Specified by:
        createCustomer in interface Createable
        Parameters:

      • convert

        protected boolean convert(java.util.List<java.lang.String> customerCommands)
        Splits apart an in-coming request into it's command, authority token and customer then maps those fields from the string to tables and columns in Horizon.
        Parameters:
        customerCommands -
        Returns:
        true if the customer files (header and data) were created and false otherwise.

      • computeEmailName

        protected java.lang.String computeEmailName(java.lang.String email)
        Horizon has an additional required field, email name, which is just the user's email name (without the domain). We compute that here.
        Parameters:
        email -
        Returns:
        String value of email account name (without the domain).
